channel.title: New, Open, Save and Save As
channel.description:
I want to actually make these do what they say in my menu. I've added an ActionListener() to all of the menu items, now how do I make them browse the systems files, and:
New - Open A New Blank Document Open - Open A Selected .txt/.java file Save - Save the open page Save As.. - Open system files and browse where you want to save
<3 <3

item.title: New, Open, Save and Save As
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Have a look at how I do it in SIDE if you want, it may be a bit more complicated than what you want to do though.

Read full topic

@frank wrote:

thats got nothing to do with what he said javac, he means using anonymous classes

item.title: New, Open, Save and Save As
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

On another topic

i would recommend not having individual classes for each action listener as it gets dirty… (thats what mopars prof does lel)

Or you can just extend FileDialog and override its processEvents method

Read full topic
